case_vignette: A 43-year-old female presents to cl   inic for evaluation of hair loss along the frontal scalp ongoing over the past year. She reports a twenty year long history    of wearin   g a wig daily and secures her hair in  place with tight    headband underneath. She denies any sign ificant pain or pruritus in the areas of hair loss. She has tried numerous over the count   er oils and shampoos without any improvement.  Physical examination reveals significant hair thinning an regression of the hairline with preservation of    the   hair follicles along the frontotemporal scalp   . No significant perifollicular erythema is   appreciated.
